DataElement.preferredName: Caries Proximal Width Physical Examination Maximum Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity as related to width of the proximal (area in mesial or distal surface of a tooth) to the axial wall (near pulpal wall parallel with long axis of the tooth) that has the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to width of the proximal (area in mesial or distal surface of a tooth) to the axial wall (near pulpal wall parallel with long axis of the tooth) that has the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Concepts.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Property.preferredDefinition: Proximal; situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.:Width; the extent of something from side to side.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: Situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.
The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity to the extent downward or inward of decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Depth; extent downward or inward.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

DataElement.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
